intro: Xylopia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower xylopia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, woody bark and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Xylopia uniflora produces fruit that is a capsule, containing several seeds, and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
